snippet: Senator Carl Levin of Michigan is one of a growing list of senior Democrats who will not seek re-election in 2014, leaving Republicans more opportunities in their attempt to take back the Senate.
abstract: Democratic Senator Carl Levin of Michigan says he plans to retire and will spend rest of his term focusing on legislative business and not campaigning; he is among growing list of senior Democrats who will not seek re-election in 2014, leaving Republicans more opportunities in their attempt to take back Senate.
lead_paragraph: Senator Carl Levin of Michigan is one of a growing list of senior Democrats who will not seek re-election in 2014, leaving Republicans more opportunities in their attempt to take back the Senate.

headline.seo: Levin Says He Won’t Run Next Year
headline.main: Democrat Says He Won’t Run for Re-election to the Senate
headline.print_headline: Democrat Says He Won’t Run For Re-election To the Senate
